page.title: 04VILLAGE ATTITUDES
page.content: The young say they need more entertaining amenities as they say that they get bored whereas the elderly say they prefer the village as it is with a small shop,hairdresser and Public_house;quiet and unhurried.The middle age group of the community have a better and more varied array of clubs and activities than children and youngsters,and the elderly have hardly anything.A vareity of watersports take place on the river and Rockland Broad,such as canoeing and fishing and also there is a private boating club.A number of pastimes can be persued in the village hall and also at nearby Claxton.These include darts,tabletennis and pool and the local play group,Brownies and Guides are housed here.
